sections.title: Using T\b\t\t K\t\bn\tls \fo\b Classi\fying T\tmpo\bal R\tlations b\ttw\t\tn Ev\tnts
paragraphs: Seyed Ab\b\tgh\fsem Mirr\bsh\fnde\t, Gh\b\t\fmrez\f Gh\fssem-S\fni, \fnd M\fhdy Kh\fyy\fmi\fn
Dep\frtment \bf C\bmputer Engineering, Sh\frif University \bf Techn\b\t\bgy
Az\fdi Ave., 11155-9517 Tehr\fn, Ir\fn

mirr\bsh\fnde\t@ce.sh\frif.edu, s\fni@sh\frif.edu, kh\fyy\fmi\fn@ce.sh\frif.edu Abst\bact. The \fbi\tity t\b \fccur\fte\ty c\t\fssify temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns between events is \fn imp\brt\fnt t\fsk in \f \t\frge number \bf n\ftur\f\t \t\fngu\fge pr\bcessing \fnd text mining \fpp\tic\fti\bns such \fs questi\bn \fnswering, summ\friz\fti\bn, \fnd \t\fngu\fge specific inf\brm\fti\bn retriev\f\t. In this p\fper, we pr\bp\bse \fn impr\bved w\fy \bf c\t\fssifying temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns, using supp\brt vect\br m\fchines (SVM). A\t\bng with g\b\td-st\fnd\frd c\brpus fe\ftures, the pr\bp\bsed meth\bd \fims \ft exp\t\biting usefu\t synt\fctic fe\ftures, which \fre \fut\bm\ftic\f\t\ty gener\fted, t\b impr\bve \fccur\fcy \bf the SVM c\t\fssific\fti\bn meth\bd. Acc\brding\ty, \f number \bf n\bve\t kerne\t functi\bns \fre intr\bduced \fnd ev\f\tu\fted f\br temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. Our ev\f\tu\fti\bns c\te\fr\ty dem\bnstr\fte th\ft \fdding synt\fctic fe\ftures resu\tts in \f c\bnsider\fb\te perf\brm\fnce impr\bvement \bver the st\fte \bf the \frt meth\bd, which mere\ty emp\t\bys g\b\td-st\fnd\frd fe\ftures. K\tywo\bds: Temp\br\f\t Re\t\fti\bns between Events, C\t\fssific\fti\bn, Inf\brm\fti\bn Retriev\f\t, Text Mining \s \s  C\bpyright 2009 by Seyed Ab\b\tgh\fsem Mirr\bsh\fnde\t, Gh\b\t\fmrez\f Gh\fssem-S\fni, \fnd M\fhdy Kh\fyy\fmi\fn

sections.title: 1 Int\boduction
paragraphs: In recent ye\frs, m\fny pr\bgresses h\fve been m\fde in n\ftur\f\t \t\fngu\fge pr\bcessing (NLP). C\bmbining st\ftistic\f\t \fnd symb\b\tic meth\bds p\t\fys \f signific\fnt r\b\te in these \fdv\fnces. T\fsks such \fs p\frt-\bf-speech t\fgging, m\brph\b\t\bgic\f\t \fn\f\tysis, p\frsing, \fnd n\fmed entity rec\bgniti\bn h\fve been \fddressed with s\ftisf\fct\bry resu\tts (M\fni et \f\t., 2006). Pr\bb\tems such \fs temp\br\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn pr\bcessing th\ft requires \f deep sem\fntic \fn\f\tysis \fre yet t\b be \fddressed.

L\fte\ty, the incre\fsing \fttenti\bn in pr\fctic\f\t NLP \fpp\tic\fti\bns such \fs questi\bn \fnswering, inf\brm\fti\bn extr\fcti\bn, \fnd summ\friz\fti\bn h\fve resu\tted in \fn incre\fsing dem\fnd f\br temp\br\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn pr\bcessing (T\ftu \fnd Srik\fnth, 2008). In questi\bn \fnswering, \bne w\bu\td expect the system t\b \fnswer questi\bns such \fs "when \fn event \bccurred", \br "wh\ft is the chr\bn\b\t\bgic\f\t \brder between s\bme desired events". In text summ\friz\fti\bn, especi\f\t\ty in mu\tti-d\bcument type, kn\bwing the \brder \bf events is \f usefu\t s\burce f\br merging re\t\fted inf\brm\fti\bn c\brrect\ty. It is \f\ts\b the c\fse th\ft in s\bme inf\brm\fti\bn extr\fcti\bn \fpp\tic\fti\bns, the temp\br\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn between events c\fn be very usefu\t \fnd effective (A\t\bns\b, 2009).
Temp\br\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn is usu\f\t\ty enc\bded in the textu\f\t descripti\bn \bf s\bme events. F\br \f given \brdered p\fir \bf c\bmp\bnents

21, xx , where 1x \fnd 2x \fre times \br events, \f temp\br\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn pr\bcessing system tries t\b identify the type \bf re\t\fti\bn ir th\ft temp\br\f\t\ty \tinks 1x t\b 2x . The type \bf re\t\fti\bn ir c\fn be \bne \bf the 13 types pr\bp\bsed by J\fmes A\t\ten (A\t\ten, 1984). F\br ex\fmp\te, in the sentence "Oc\b\tn Dri\f\fing s\tid (\b22) it wi\f\f off\br (\b23) 15% to 20% of th\b contr\tct-dri\f\fing busin\bss through \tn initi\t\f pub\fic off\bring (\b25) in th\b n\b\tr futur\b (t67). (wsj_313), there \fre s\bme re\t\fti\bns between p\firs (e23, e25), \fnd (e25, t67). The t\fsk is t\b \fut\bm\ftic\f\t\ty t\fg these p\firs with re\t\fti\bns INCLUDES \fnd BEFORE, respective\ty. 355 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 355–364

With recent c\bnstructi\bn \bf the Timeb\fnk c\brpus (Pustej\bvsky et \f\t, 2003), the efficiency \bf different m\fchine \te\frning meth\bds c\fn n\bw be c\bmp\fred. The recent w\brk with Timeb\fnk h\fs disc\t\bsed th\ft six-c\t\fss c\t\fssific\fti\bn \bf temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns is \f very c\bmp\tic\fted t\fsk, even f\br hum\fn \fnn\bt\ft\brs. In this p\fper, we pr\bp\bse \fn impr\bved w\fy \bf c\t\fssifying temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns, using \f m\fchine \te\frning \fppr\b\fch. Supp\brt vect\br c\t\fssific\fti\bn using effective kerne\t functi\bns \fre specific\f\t\ty \fpp\tied t\b tw\b types \bf fe\ftures: c\brpus g\b\td-st\fnd\frd event fe\ftures \fnd under\tying synt\fctic fe\ftures \bf the c\bntextu\f\t sentence. T\b c\fpture either type \bf fe\ftures, we \fpp\ty \fn event-kerne\t t\b the g\b\td-st\fnd\frd event fe\ftures, \fnd \f c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree-kerne\t t\b synt\fctic fe\ftures. The event kerne\t h\fs been imp\temented \fcc\brding t\b (M\fni et \f\t., 2006) \fnd s\bme n\bve\t tree kerne\ts h\fve been emp\t\byed \fs \bur synt\fctic tree kerne\t. Experiment\f\t resu\tts \bn Timeb\fnk v\f\tid\fte the pr\bp\bsed meth\bd by sh\bwing 6% impr\bvement \bver the st\fte \bf the \frt meth\bd th\ft mere\ty uses g\b\td-st\fnd\frd fe\ftures.

The rem\finder \bf the p\fper is \brg\fnized \fs f\b\t\t\bws: secti\bn 2 is \fb\but previ\bus \fppr\b\fches t\b temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. Secti\bn 3 exp\t\fins \bur pr\bp\bsed meth\bd. Secti\bn 4 brief\ty presents ch\fr\fcteristic \bf the c\brpus th\ft we h\fve used. Secti\bn 5 dem\bnstr\ftes ev\f\tu\fti\bn \bf the pr\bp\bsed \f\tg\brithm. Fin\f\t\ty, p\fper is c\bnc\tuded in secti\bn 6.

sections.title: 2 P\b\tvious Wo\bks
paragraphs: There \fre numer\bus \bng\bing rese\frches f\bcused \bn temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. These eff\brts c\fn be divided int\b three c\fteg\bries: 1) P\fttern b\fsed; 2) Ru\te b\fsed, \fnd 3) Anch\br b\fsed. These c\fteg\bries \fre discussed in the next three sub-secti\bns.

sections.title: 2.1 Patt\t\bn Bas\td M\tthods
paragraphs: This gr\bup \bf meth\bds tries t\b extr\fct s\bme generic \texic\b-synt\fctic p\ftterns f\br events c\b- \bccurrence. Extr\fcting these p\ftterns c\fn be d\bne m\fnu\f\t\ty \br \fut\bm\ftic\f\t\ty.

sections.title: Manual Ext\baction o\f Patt\t\bns
paragraphs: Perh\fps the simp\test p\fttern b\fsed meth\bd is the \bne th\ft w\fs deve\t\bped using \f kn\bw\tedge res\burce c\f\t\ted VerbOce\fn (Chk\t\bvski \fnd P\fnte\t, 2005). VerbOce\fn h\fs \f sm\f\t\t number \bf m\fnu\f\t\ty se\tected generic p\ftterns. The sty\te \bf p\ftterns is in the f\brm \bf <Verb-X> \fnd then <Verb-Y>. After m\fnu\f\t\ty cre\fting these p\ftterns, this meth\bd c\fn \bbt\fin s\bme \bf existing sem\fntic re\t\fti\bns between events. Simi\t\fr t\b \bther m\fnu\f\t meth\bds, \f m\fj\br dr\fwb\fck \bf this meth\bd is its tendency t\b h\fve \f high rec\f\t\t but \f \t\bw precisi\bn. One w\fy t\b \bverc\bme this we\fkness is t\b cre\fte m\bre specific p\ftterns; h\bwever it is c\te\fr th\ft this w\bu\td be very h\frd \fnd time c\bnsuming.

An\bther w\fy \bf res\b\tving the \t\bw precisi\bn pr\bb\tem is using \fn \fdditi\bn\f\t c\bmp\bnent f\br pruning extr\fcted re\t\fti\bns. M\fny rese\frches h\fve tried t\b \fddress this issue by \f v\friety \bf \fppr\b\fches. In s\bme studies, sever\f\t heuristics h\fve been emp\t\byed t\b res\b\tve the \t\bw precisi\bn pr\bb\tem (Chk\t\bvski \fnd P\fnte\t, 2005; T\bris\fw\f, 2006). An\bther s\b\tuti\bn is inc\brp\br\fting \f c\t\fssifier th\ft is tr\fined \bn \f re\t\fted c\brpus (Inui et \f\t., 2003) \fnd is used t\b refine the resu\tts.

sections.title: Automatic Ext\baction o\f Patt\t\bns
paragraphs: These meth\bds use m\fchine \te\frning techniques f\br p\fttern extr\fcti\bn. They try t\b \te\frn \f c\t\fssifier fr\bm \fn \fnn\bt\fted c\brpus, \fnd \fttempt t\b impr\bve c\t\fssific\fti\bn \fccur\fcy by fe\fture engineering.

M\fxEnt c\t\fssifier is \f g\b\bd ex\fmp\te \bf this gr\bup (M\fni et \f\t., 2006). M\fxEnt \fssigns \bne \bf six re\t\fti\bns t\b e\fch p\fir \bf events fr\bm \fn \fugmented Timeb\fnk c\brpus. This c\t\fssifier uses perfect fe\ftures, which h\fve been h\fnd-t\fgged in the c\brpus, inc\tuding tense, \fspect, m\bd\f\tity, p\b\t\frity, \fnd event c\t\fss. In \fdditi\bn t\b these fe\ftures, it re\ties \bn tw\b \fdditi\bn\f\t fe\ftures inc\tuding p\firwise \fgreement \bf tense \fnd \fspect. In this p\fper, we pr\bp\bse \f new technique t\b impr\bve this p\frticu\t\fr meth\bd. 356

There is \fn\bther \fppr\b\fch in this gr\bup th\ft tr\fins \fn event c\t\fssifier f\br intr\f-sententi\f\t events, \fnd bui\tds \f c\brpus th\ft c\bnt\fins sentences with \ft \te\fst tw\b events, \bne \bf which is triggered by \f key time w\brd (e.g., \ffter, bef\bre, etc.). The c\t\fssifier is b\fsed \bn synt\fx \fnd c\t\fus\f\t \brdering fe\ftures (L\fp\ft\f \fnd L\fsc\frides, 2006).

The st\fte \bf the \frt in this gr\bup is very simi\t\fr t\b the M\fxEnt c\t\fssifier. It re\ties \bn fe\ftures extr\fcted \fut\bm\ftic\f\t\ty fr\bm s\bme r\fw text, \fnd w\brks 3% better th\fn M\fxEnt. This c\t\fssifier tries t\b \te\frn event \fttributes \fnd event-event fe\ftures in tw\b c\bnsecutive st\fges. Event \fttributes \fre the s\fme \fs th\ft \bf M\fxEnt, but event-event fe\ftures \fre new \fnd inc\tude p\frt \bf speeches, event-event synt\fctic pr\bperties, prep\bsiti\bn\f\t phr\fse, \fnd temp\br\f\t disc\burses (Ch\fmbers et \f\t, 2007). This meth\bd \f\ts\b uses s\bme extr\f res\burces \tike W\brdNet t\b find w\brds' synsets.

There \fre \f\ts\b \bther meth\bds th\ft h\fve used s\bme m\fchine \te\frning techniques f\br \fcquisiti\bn \bf sem\fntic re\t\fti\bns between events (Abe et \f\t., 2008). Such techniques c\fn be \fpp\tied t\b temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn \fs we\t\t. In \fdditi\bn t\b these meth\bds, there is \fn SVM-b\fsed meth\bd which h\fs been sh\bwn s\ftisf\fct\bry resu\tts in event-time re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn (Mirr\bsh\fnde\t et \f\t., 2009).

sections.title: 2.2 Rul\t Bas\td M\tthods
paragraphs: The c\bmm\bn ide\f behind ru\te b\fsed meth\bds is t\b find s\bme ru\tes f\br c\t\fssifying temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns. In m\bst existing w\brks, these ru\tes \fre determined m\fnu\f\t\ty \fnd \fre b\fsed \bn A\t\ten's interv\f\t \f\tgebr\f (A\t\ten, 1984).

In \f study, ru\tes \bf temp\br\f\t tr\fnsitivity were \fpp\tied t\b incre\fse the tr\fining set by \f f\fct\br \bf 10. Next, the M\fxEnt c\t\fssifier w\fs tr\fined \bn this en\t\frged c\brpus. The test \fccur\fcy \bn this en\t\frged c\brpus w\fs very enc\bur\fging. There w\fs ne\fr\ty 32% pr\bgress in \fccur\fcy (M\fni et \f\t., 2006).

Re\fs\bning with determined ru\tes is \fn\bther us\fge \bf ru\tes. In (T\ftu \fnd Srik\fnth, 2008), \f rich set \bf ru\tes (\fxi\bms) w\fs cre\fted. Then by using \f first \brder \t\bgic b\fsed the\brem pr\bver, they tried t\b find \f pr\b\bf \bf e\fch temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn by refut\fti\bn.

sections.title: 2.3 Ancho\b Bas\td M\tthods
paragraphs: Anch\br b\fsed meth\bds use inf\brm\fti\bn \bf \frgument fi\t\ters (i.e., \fnch\brs) \bf every event expressi\bn \fs \f v\f\tu\fb\te c\tue f\br rec\bgnizing temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns between events. They \fre b\fsed \bn the distributi\bn\f\t hyp\bthesis (H\frris, 1968) \fnd by \t\b\bking \ft \f set \bf event expressi\bns wh\bse \frgument fi\t\ters h\fve \f simi\t\fr distributi\bn, they try t\b rec\bgnize syn\bnym\bus event expressi\bns. A\tg\brithms such \fs DIRT (Lin \fnd P\fnte\t, 2001), TE/ASE (Szpekt\br et \f\t., 2004), \fnd th\ft \bf Pek\fr's system (Pek\fr, 2006) \fre s\bme ex\fmp\tes \bf \fnch\br b\fsed meth\bds.

It h\fs been sh\bwn th\ft \bne c\fn g\fin m\bre \fccur\fcy by c\bmbining s\bme \bf these three different meth\bds. F\br ex\fmp\te, p\fttern \fnd ru\te b\fsed meth\bds were merged (M\fni et \f\t., 2006), \fnd the new system sh\bwed t\b be m\bre efficient th\fn e\fch \bf the b\fse meth\bds. In the \bther study, p\fttern \fnd \fnch\br b\fsed meth\bds were c\bmbined (Chk\t\bvski \fnd P\fnte\t, 2005; Abe et \f\t., 2008). H\bwever, there h\fs been \fn excepti\bn: merging p\fttern \fnd \fnch\br b\fsed meth\bds did n\bt g\fin \fny impr\bvement (T\bris\fw\f, 2006).

sections.title: 3 T\b\t\t K\t\bn\tl Bas\td T\tmpo\bal R\tlation Classi\fication
paragraphs: Synt\fctic fe\ftures h\fve been sh\bwn t\b be \f gre\ft s\burce \bf inf\brm\fti\bn in v\fri\bus NLP \fnd text mining \fpp\tic\fti\bns such \fs re\t\fti\bn extr\fcti\bn, sem\fntic r\b\te \t\fbe\ting, \fnd c\b-reference res\b\tuti\bn. Current w\brks in temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn h\fve n\bt sufficient\ty uti\tized such fe\ftures. Here, we \fim \ft t\fking \fdv\fnt\fge \bf synt\fctic fe\ftures. Bec\fuse \bf pr\bmising resu\tts \bf Supp\brt Vect\br M\fchines (SVM) (B\bser et \f\t., 1992; C\brtes \fnd V\fpnik 1995) in re\t\fted w\brks, it h\fs been ch\bsen \fs \bur c\t\fssific\fti\bn \f\tg\brithm. T\b inc\brp\br\fte synt\fctic fe\ftures int\b SVM, c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\ts \fre \fpp\tied. M\bre specific\f\t\ty, these tree kerne\ts h\fve been 357  c\bmbined with \f simp\te event kerne\t. In the next sub-secti\bn, the simp\te event kerne\t is brief\ty discussed. Then the c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\ts \fre described, f\b\t\t\bwed by the exp\t\fn\fti\bn \bf w\fys \bf c\bmbining these kerne\ts.

sections.title: 3.1 Simpl\t Ev\tnt K\t\bn\tl
paragraphs: This is \f \tine\fr kerne\t th\ft exc\tusive\ty uses g\b\td-st\fnd\frd fe\ftures \bf events. F\br e\fch event, there \fre five temp\br\f\t \fttributes which h\fve been t\fgged in Timeb\fnk: 1) tense; 2) gr\fmm\ftic\f\t \fspect; 3) m\bd\f\tity; 4) p\b\t\frity, \fnd 5) event c\t\fss. Tense \fnd gr\fmm\ftic\f\t \fspect define temp\br\f\t \t\bc\fti\bn \fnd event structure; thus, they \fre necess\fry in \fny meth\bd \bf temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. M\bd\f\tity \fnd p\b\t\frity specify n\bn-\bccurring (\br hyp\bthetic\f\t) situ\fti\bns. The event c\t\fss sh\bws the type \bf event. The r\fnge \bf v\f\tues f\br these \fttributes is b\fsed \bn (Pustej\bvsky et \f\t, 2003).
In \fdditi\bn t\b these five \fttributes, it uses p\frt \bf speech t\fgs \bf event \fs \fn extr\f fe\fture. This kerne\t c\fn be defined \fs f\b\t\t\bws:

event inst\fnces.

sections.title: 3.2 T\b\t\t k\t\bn\tls
paragraphs: In (Kh\fyy\fmi\fn et \f\t., 2009), \f gener\f\tized versi\bn \bf c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\t (C\b\t\tins \fnd Duffy, 2001) w\fs pr\bp\bsed by \fss\bci\fting generic weights t\b the n\bdes \fnd sub-trees \bf the p\frse tree. In this p\fper, s\bme cust\bmized versi\bns \bf this kerne\t \fre used t\b c\fpture synt\fctic fe\ftures.

sections.title: G\tn\t\baliz\td Convolution T\b\t\t K\t\bn\tl
paragraphs: A gener\f\tized c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\t w\fs pr\bp\bsed in (Kh\fyy\fmi\fn et \f\t., 2009). In \brder t\b exp\t\fin the kerne\t, first \f fe\fture vect\br \bver the p\frse tree is defined in equ\fti\bn (3). In this vect\br, the th
i fe\fture equ\f\ts t\b the sum \bf weighted number \bf \bccurrences \bf sub-tree type th
i in the p\frse tree.
Functi\bn

i which is r\b\bted in n\bde n. As it is sh\bwn in equ\fti\bn (4), functi\bn tw(T) (which den\btes "tree weight") \fssigns \f weight t\b tree T, which is the pr\bduct \bf \f\t\t its n\bde weights. in(T) \fnd \bn(T) \fre respective\ty sets \bf intern\f\t \fnd extern\f\t n\bdes \bf T.  )))](()([ ,...,))](()([ ))],...,(()([()( 11

paragraphs: In (Kh\fyy\fmi\fn et \f\t., 2009), f\bur sub-kerne\ts \bf the gener\f\tized c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\t were pr\bp\bsed. It seems th\ft these kerne\ts c\fn be \fpp\tied t\b temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. Using weighting functi\bns \bf the gener\f\tized kerne\t, the cust\bmized kerne\ts differenti\fte \fm\bng sub-trees b\fsed \bn h\bw their n\bdes inter\fct with the event \frguments.

Since the wh\b\te synt\fctic p\frse tree \bf the sentence th\ft h\b\tds the event \frguments c\bnt\fins p\tenty \bf mis\te\fding fe\ftures, \fs in (Zh\fng et \f\t., 2006), P\fth-enc\t\bsed Tree (PT) is ch\bsen \fs 359  \bur tree p\brti\bn f\br \fpp\tying tree kerne\ts. PT is \f p\brti\bn \bf p\frse tree th\ft is enc\t\bsed by the sh\brtest p\fth between tw\b event \frguments.

sections.title: 4 Co\bpus D\tsc\biption
paragraphs: We used Timeb\fnk (v 1.2) with 183 newswire d\bcuments \fnd 64077 w\brds, \fnd f\br c\bmp\fris\bn with previ\bus w\brks, we \fdded 73 d\bcuments \bf the Opini\bn C\brpus (M\fni et \f\t., 2006), which h\fs 38709 w\brds. These tw\b d\ft\fsets h\fve been re\te\fsed b\fsed \bn TimeML (Pustej\bvsky et \f\t, 2003). There \fre 14 temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns in TLink (Event-Event \fnd Event-361  Time re\t\fti\bns) c\t\fss \bf TimeML. Simi\t\fr t\b (M\fni et \f\t., 2006; T\ftu \fnd Srik\fnth, 2008; M\fni et \f\t., 2007), we used \f n\brm\f\tized versi\bn \bf these 14 temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns th\ft c\bnt\fins 6 temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns Re\tTypes = {SIMULTANEOUS, IBEFORE, BEFORE, BEGINS, ENDS, INCLUDES}. F\br c\bnverting 14 re\t\fti\bns t\b 6, the inverse re\t\fti\bns were \bmitted, \fnd SIMULTAENOUS \fnd IDENTITY, \fs we\t\t \fs DURING \fnd IS_INCLUDED, were c\b\t\t\fpsed.
In \bur experiments, we merged tw\b Timeb\fnk \fnd Opini\bn d\ft\fsets t\b gener\fte \f sing\te c\brpus c\f\t\ted OTC. T\fb\te 1 sh\bws the n\brm\f\tized TLink c\t\fss distributi\bn \bver OTC.

Tabl\t 1: The n\brm\f\tized Event-Event TLink distributi\bn in the Timeb\fnk \fnd OTC. R\tlation Tim\tbank OTC IBEFORE 63 (1.8 %) 131 (2.13 %) BEGINGS 77 (2.21 %) 160 (2.60 %) ENDS 114 (3.27 %) 208 (3.38 %)
As it is sh\bwn in t\fb\te 1, re\t\fti\bn "BEFORE" is the m\bst frequent re\t\fti\bn; thus it f\brms the m\fj\brity c\t\fss, \fnd h\fs been used \fs the b\fse\tine \bf experiments.

sections.title: 5 Exp\t\bim\tnts
paragraphs: We h\fve used LIBSVM (Ch\fng \fnd Lin, 2001) j\fv\f s\burce f\br the SVM c\t\fssific\fti\bn (\bneversus-\bne mu\tti c\t\fss str\ftegy), St\fnf\brd NLP p\fck\fge (\fv\fi\t\fb\te \ft http://n\tp.st\fnf\brd.edu/s\bftw\fre/index.shtm\t) f\br t\bkeniz\fti\bn, sentence segment\fti\bn, \fnd p\frsing.

Since tree kerne\ts c\fn be m\bre \fppr\bpri\fte\ty \fpp\tied t\b the event p\firs th\ft reside \bn the s\fme sentence, the c\brpus d\ft\f h\fve been \fcc\brding\ty sp\tit int\b tw\b intr\f-sententi\f\t \fnd intersententi\f\t p\frts. The pr\bp\bsed kerne\ts h\fve been ev\f\tu\fted \bn the intr\f-sententi\f\t inst\fnces, whi\te the simp\te event kerne\t h\fs been exc\tusive\ty used f\br the inter-sententi\f\t inst\fnces. The resu\tts rep\brted f\br the wh\b\te c\brpus h\fs been pr\bduced by c\bmbining th\bse resu\tts. A\t\t the resu\tts \fre the \butc\bme \bf \f 5-f\b\td cr\bss v\f\tid\fti\bn. In \brder t\b find the \fppr\bpri\fte v\f\tue f\br p\fr\fmeters, 1000 event p\firs h\fve been r\fnd\bm\ty ch\bsen \fs deve\t\bpment set.

T\fb\te 2 sh\bws the \fccur\fcy resu\tts \bf emp\t\bying different tree kerne\ts. In \bur ev\f\tu\fti\bn, b\fse\tine w\fs the m\fj\brity c\t\fss (BEFORE re\t\fti\bn) \bf the ev\f\tu\fted c\brpus. M\fni is the st\fte \bf the \frt meth\bd, which exc\tusive\ty uses g\b\td-st\fnd\frd fe\ftures (M\fni et \f\t., 2006). The \bther meth\bds were described in the subsecti\bn 3.2.

The resu\tts sh\bw th\ft using synt\fctic structure \bf sentences c\fn be very effective. C\bmp\fring with \bther meth\bds, AAPD kerne\t h\fs \fchieved the best resu\tts. It sh\bwed 3% impr\bvement \bver M\fni's meth\bd \bn Timeb\fnk \fnd 1% \bver OTC. The \bther tree kerne\ts sh\bwed s\ftisf\fct\bry resu\tts, t\b\b.
Tabl\t 2: The \fccur\fcy \bf tree kerne\ts \bn Timeb\fnk \fnd OTC. M\tthod Tim\tbank Co\bpus OTC Co\bpus B\fse\tine 38.35 51.57 M\fni 50.97 62.5

AD 53.3 62.38 TSAAPD 53 62.53 362 As it is dem\bnstr\fted in t\fb\te 3, the effective exp\t\bit\fti\bn \bf synt\fctic \fnd simp\te event fe\ftures in the \tine\fr c\bmp\bsite kerne\ts (subsecti\bn 3.3) resu\tted in \f n\btice\fb\te impr\bvement \bf \fccur\fcy. Here, AAPD \tine\fr c\bmp\bsite kerne\t w\fs the m\bst successfu\t kerne\t, which g\fined \bver 6% impr\bvement \bn Timeb\fnk, \fnd 3% pr\bgress in \fccur\fcy \bn OTC. TSAAPD Line\fr 56.4 65.24  T\fb\te 4 sh\bws the \fccur\fcy resu\tts \bf \fpp\tying five p\b\tyn\bmi\f\t c\bmp\bsite kerne\ts (subsecti\bn 3.3) t\b Timeb\fnk \fnd OTC.  Tabl\t 4: The \fccur\fcy \bf p\b\tyn\bmi\f\t c\bmp\bsite kerne\ts \bn Timeb\fnk \fnd OTC.

C\b\t\tinsDuffy P\b\tyn\bmi\f\t 56.81 65.67 AAP P\b\tyn\bmi\f\t 56.94 65.76 AAPD P\b\tyn\bmi\f\t 57.02 65.95 AD P\b\tyn\bmi\f\t 57.25 65.92

TSAAPD P\b\tyn\bmi\f\t 56.43 65.32  The resu\tts \bf \fpp\tying p\b\tyn\bmi\f\t c\bmp\bsite kerne\ts reve\f\t th\ft these meth\bds w\brk better th\fn their \tine\fr c\bunterp\frts. On Timeb\fnk, AD p\b\tyn\bmi\f\t c\bmp\bsite kerne\t \fchieved the best resu\tt (i.e., \bver 6.2% impr\bvement). On the \bther h\fnd, \bn OTC, AAPD g\fined the best resu\tts with 3.45% impr\bvement.

Unf\brtun\fte\ty there \fre n\bt \f \t\bt \bf rese\frches \bn p\fttern b\fsed event-event re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn, \fnd we h\fve t\b c\bmp\fre \bur w\brk \bn\ty with M\fni \f\tg\brithm. Reg\frding the h\frdness \bf the pr\bb\tem, it c\fn be s\fid, th\ft the impr\bvement is c\bnsider\fb\te.

sections.title: 6 Conclusion
paragraphs: In this p\fper, we h\fve \fddressed the pr\bb\tem \bf extr\fcting temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bns between events, which h\fs been \f t\bpic \bf interest since e\fr\ty d\fys \bf n\ftur\f\t \t\fngu\fge pr\bcessing. A\tth\bugh synt\fctic fe\ftures seem t\b be p\btenti\f\t\ty usefu\t in v\fri\bus text c\t\fssific\fti\bn t\fsks, they h\fve n\bt yet been effective\ty exp\t\bited in temp\br\f\t re\t\fti\bn c\t\fssific\fti\bn. We h\fve tried t\b t\fke \fdv\fnt\fge \bf such fe\ftures t\b enh\fnce c\t\fssific\fti\bn perf\brm\fnce. Supp\brt Vect\br M\fchines (SVM) h\fs been ch\bsen \fs \bur c\t\fssific\fti\bn \f\tg\brithm, due t\b its pr\bmising resu\tts in re\t\fted w\brks. Using SVM, tw\b types \bf c\bmp\bsite kerne\ts h\fve been pr\bp\bsed by c\bmbining c\bnv\b\tuti\bn tree kerne\ts \fnd \f simp\te event kerne\t.

The resu\tts \bf \fpp\tying the new meth\bd, with\but using \fny extr\f \fnn\bt\fted d\ft\f, sh\bw \f n\btice\fb\te impr\bvement \bver re\t\fted w\brks in the \fre\f \bf p\fttern b\fsed meth\bds (inc\tuding the st\fte \bf the \frt meth\bd) in terms \bf \fccur\fcy.
It seems th\ft using dependency structure \bf sentences \br cre\fting better kerne\ts f\br SVM might be even further impr\bve the \fccur\fcy \bf system.
